skillTree.name: Barded Ithilmar Steed
skillTree.description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

skillTree.name: Great Eagle
skillTree.description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

skillTree.name: Griffon
skillTree.description: The wild Griffons of Ulthuan are creatures of noble bearing and keen intelligence, with whom Elves form bonds that only death can shatter.

skillTree.name: Sun Dragon
skillTree.description: The youngest Dragons have a warm hue to their scales and a fiery temper, with scorching breath to match.

skillTree.name: Star Dragon
skillTree.description: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

skillTree.name: Speed of Asuryan
skillTree.description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.

skillTree.name: Ward of Loec
skillTree.description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.

skillTree.name: Ward of Hoeth
skillTree.description: Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Mentor
skillTree.description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Influential
skillTree.description: This general's political influence is disproportionately large, aiding in political aspirations - all for the benefit of the faction, of course.

skillTree.name: Renowned Lord
skillTree.description: This one's deeds are legendary, inspiring mercenaries and heroes alike to join their cause.

effects.description: Unit capacity: +1 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +2 for Regiments of Renown
Unit capacity: +3 for Regiments of Renown

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Asuryan
skillTree.description: Asuryan's adherents believe they are part of the Creator's plan and will never be abandoned.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Hoeth
skillTree.description: The supporters of Hoeth bask in their patron's generosity, for it was he who gifted the Elves with much of their revered knowledge.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +5% when increasing

Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Vaul
skillTree.description: The God of Smiths knows the Elves will need fire and fury to survive; his blessings steel them for the darker days ahead.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Kurnous
skillTree.description: Isha's husband is the father of all Elves; his blessings are given to those who hunt for food, but woe betide those who kill for sport.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Isha
skillTree.description: The Goddess of Fertility blesses farmers and mothers, but also those votaries who are caught abroad in dangerous lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Spearmen and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Addaioth
skillTree.description: Those who follow the Bringer of Wrath and Fire are blessed with direct and forceful solutions to the obstacles in their way.

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Mathlann
skillTree.description: As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Dedicated to Hukon
skillTree.description: If you can hold you ground when all around are falling into the cracks, then that's the patronage of Hukon, God of Earthquakes.

skillTree.name: Juggernaut
skillTree.description: Sometimes the best offense is, in fact, simply the embodiment of offense; a champion who can scythe through weaklings like wheat and shatter even the strongest defense.

skillTree.name: Duelist
skillTree.description: This one is no mere brute, but a warrior capable of leading or delaying blows to catch foes off guard, bypassing defenses and dodges alike.

skillTree.name: Brute
skillTree.description: Skill holds value, but strength seizes results. All the skill in the world, the prettiest lies and the hardest invective, serve only to obscure the truth of the world - that one must have the might to destroy , and the will to use it, to change anything.

skillTree.name: Onslaught
skillTree.description: The force of arrival is a profound weapon, one all too many warriors neglect. Not merely in presentation, though that is also important - but the bone-shattering force of the first onslaught, before the foe has your measure; before they know they should be running.

skillTree.name: Overwhelm
skillTree.description: On the field of battle, few fights indeed boil down to something as nice and pretty as an honorable duel. Victory comes, not as the result of fair combat - but the ability to tear through battle lines, alone or with an army, until there are none left to oppose you.

skillTree.name: Titan
skillTree.description: Defense comes in many forms; blocking, parrying, avoiding, or simply ignoring an attack entirely all serve to avoid harm and demoralize a foe who cannot truly harm you.

skillTree.name: Immortis
skillTree.description: Trickery and agility are useful enough, but little displays innate strength as well as being able to simply shrug off cannonballs and shrieking daemonflame alike.

skillTree.name: Mirage
skillTree.description: The essence of victory in a duel is simple; do not be where your opponent's blade is. Easier said than done, for some. But this one knows the truth. They know how to move, or how to predict, though it is never quite clear to the foe what that truth may be.

skillTree.name: Impregnable
skillTree.description: The flesh is weak. It can bleed and burn. Iron, literal or metaphorical, is the truest defense. Whether through plate armor or potent wards, this warrior is no easy mark.

skillTree.name: Invincible
skillTree.description: True invincibility may be a vanishing dream, but one can come close enough that the difference is academic at best on the battlefield.

skillTree.name: Tactician
skillTree.description: A general's mind is as important a weapon as any blade, and must be honed just the same. To master the self is to master the world, using their army as an extension of themselves.

skillTree.name: Maneuver
skillTree.description: Too many warriors believe that movement is not a part of battle - but there is no battle without movement. Those that think statically are forever doomed to be run circles around by their foe.

effects.description:
Movement speed: +3% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +6% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +10% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Unyielding
skillTree.description: Few can claim to truly be tireless, and those that are oft trade that boon for the will of a demanding god. But even the least man or grot can be trained to move beyond their limits, to keep going where their equals fade and fall.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -5% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -10% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Symbol
skillTree.description: Those who march beneath this general's banner take pride in their presence. They are more than an army - they are an ideal, and ideals never die.

skillTree.name: Epochal
skillTree.description: There are those whose very presence awakens something new in the hearts of their followers; whether through fear, admiration, or devotion, a single thought crosses the minds of all those that behold them. 'I would die for them' 'I would kill for them.' It is difficult to tell which is the most terrifying.

skillTree.name: Adept
skillTree.description: Pure strength and arcane mastery are valid paths to victory, but cultivating the skill to step up when needed can break stalemates and lead to victory.

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Superlative Duelist
skillTree.description: This one excels in the heat of the moment, pitting the peak of their skill against their foe's and learning which is the greater.

skillTree.name: Immovable
skillTree.description: Even an unstoppable force cannot break an immovable object. Learning to stem the tide, to stand against all comers and survive, can turn defeat into victory.

skillTree.name: Ulthuan's Finest
skillTree.description: Once world police, the High Elves will rise again to purge Chaos from the planet.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +5% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Offensive Infantry
skillTree.description: Aggressive deployment of experienced shock infantry can create gaps in the frontlines of opposing forces, openings to exploit with auxiliary forces or elite infantry.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5% for all melee infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +5% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10% for all melee infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +15% for all melee infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -30% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Defensive Infantry
skillTree.description: Combined-arms tactics fall apart if the line cannot hold. Thus, it is not that the line should hold - it must hold. There is no other option. Old hands and old warriors, united to protect that which lies behind them.

effects.description:
Melee defense: +5% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Armor: +5% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Armor: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: +20% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +15% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Armor: +15% for all infantry and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: +20% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: +10% for all infantry and monstrous infantry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Ranged Infantry
skillTree.description: Squad- and regiment-size fire support takes many forms, but offers reasonable mobility and on-the-spot fire support for engaged allies, usually from medium range.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +5% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +10% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +15% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Enable Ability: "Peerless Aim" for all missile infantry, monstrous infantry, and cavalry (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Ranged Support
skillTree.description: Heavy fire support can take many forms, but tend to bring firepower to bear that is difficult or impossible to match by smaller units. Whether through unmatched mobile fire support or raw potency of earth-rending barrages, it can demoralize and tear opposing forces apart.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +5% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +10% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Range: +20% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Reload speed: +15% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Range: +20% for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Enable Ability: "Devastating Volleys" for all artillery, monstrous artillery, and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Warbeasts
skillTree.description: Beasts of war, born of flesh and steel. Often imposing or outright terrifying, they shine as linebreakers and unignorable distractions, forcing the foe to dedicate significant resources to put them down rather than on more vulnerable auxiliaries.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +5% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +5% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +15% for all monsters
	(Lord's army)

Splash attack power: +20% for all monsters (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Strider for all monsters (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Doctrine: Fast Attack
skillTree.description: Fast support units tend to lack the staying power of line forces, but offer unmatched mobility and potent shock potential to a balanced army. Preying on vulnerable support forces or engaged infantry, a thunderous charge or howling assault can shatter enemy forces in seconds.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +5% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +5% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +10% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Mass +20% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +15% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +15% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Mass +20% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ability: Old Hunters for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Steady Offense
skillTree.description: Where battlefield conditions and the flow of battle permits, taking the opportunity to press forwards can push battle lines forwards.

skillTree.name: Thunderous Charge
skillTree.description: Ride for ruin, and the world's ending.

stat_effects.description: x0 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
x0 Dealt Collision Knocked Down Threshold
x0 Dealt Collision Knocked Flying Threshold

skillTree.name: Darken the Skies
skillTree.description: Volley after volley will cut down foes, leaving nothing but a sea of corpses.

skillTree.name: Determined Advance
skillTree.description: Pure power must be matched by disciplined determination - the ability to follow formation and not overextend in a wild frenzy of destruction. Pacing themselves allows a warrior to fight on, dealing accurate blows for longer.

skillTree.name: Brutal Onslaught
skillTree.description: Power is the only absolute. Let them cower behind their armor, their battle-hyms, their war-cries. They will break before our weapons will.

skillTree.name: Steady Defense
skillTree.description: Even with all the cards seemingly against them, a sturdy defense led by the bravest or boldest can hold the line until conditions improve.

skillTree.name: Iron Legions
skillTree.description: Advancing into hellfire amidst a storm of steel requires warriors built of sterner stuff. Learning how to approach volleys of gunfire or screaming warpflame, how to utilize armor or blades to deflect or dampen it. Surviving the training makes the battlefield itself seem trivial.

skillTree.name: Bloodied But Unbowed
skillTree.description: Even the greatest generals must sometimes concede the initiative to the foe -but to do so is not to concede the battle. If one can weather the storm, if they can survive the hardest strikes, the opportunity to strike back will always, always present itself.

skillTree.name: Flow Like Water
skillTree.description: Mobility is perhaps the greatest weapon a warrior can wield. Outmaneuvering the foe, pressing the advantage, can turn even a sure defeat into victory.

skillTree.name: Strategist
skillTree.description: Wars are won, not merely by strength of arms, but by supply lines and grand strategy. Winning a single battle means nothing if that victory is not in pursuit of a greater purpose.

skillTree.name: The Long March
skillTree.description: An army is only as fast as its slowest contingent. Understanding and applying this concept allows for unorthodox tactics and outmaneuvering the foe.

skillTree.name: Natural Leader
skillTree.description: This general has a knack for attracting others to their cause and gauging exactly how far they can drive their forces, minimizing unnecessary losses and making it easier to replace fallen forces with willing warriors.

skillTree.name: Auxiliary Supply Lines
skillTree.description: It is said that supplies win war rather than strategy. Perspective may temper one's opinion on that claim, but having resilient supply lines that can keep troops in good form does help.

skillTree.name: Reinforced Supply Infrastructure
skillTree.description: Penetrating hostile territory where the land is as dangerous as its inhabitants can cause tremendous damage to an army and strain supply lines, unless properly reinforced and supported by effective scouting allowing for relatively safe passage.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Prescience
skillTree.description: Whether this general possesses true prescience or merely some facsimile of it is a subject of some debate, but the efficacy of their judgements is difficult to question. Few succeed at surprising them, and fewer still can do so on the field of battle.

skillTree.name: General
skillTree.description: Ths lord is not merely a general by necessity, or even choice; it is simply a natural evolution of what they are - of who they are.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +50
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Break and Remake
skillTree.description: New recruits must be broken in order to be remade, undergoing harsh training now in order to become part of the elite.

skillTree.name: Experienced Recruiters
skillTree.description: Finding high quality recruits for any army can be difficult, but made much easier by a network of competent recruiters that can find more and more to join the cause.

skillTree.name: Drill Sergeants
skillTree.description: Recruiting the finest forces to be found and training them harder than anyone else leads to unusually high quality additions to the army.

effects.description:
Unit recruit rank: +1
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +2
	(armies in local province)

Unit recruit rank: +3
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.name: Endless Journey
skillTree.description: Training does not end when war begins; an army that is not marching or fighting is ripe for rigorous practice, and any flaws in their previous training can always be identified and corrected as possible.

skillTree.name: Exarch
skillTree.description: Expertise in a particular territory leaves this general better prepared to govern than most, in whatever manner best sorts their kind.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -25% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Cult of Personality
skillTree.description: This lord's name is spread wherever they go, inspiring fear and adulation alike. Whether bolstered by overwhelming charisma, arcane might, or unfathomable cruelty, the populace is acutely aware of their presence - and their might.

skillTree.name: Incandescent
skillTree.description: The pure and the good need not share a bed, but against the fires of truth there can be no shelter for those that would twist and turn against the natural order.

skillTree.name: Social Study
skillTree.description: An empire cannot thrive without its people, and an army cannot march without warm bodies to fill it. How this lord encourage such proliferation is perhaps best left to the imagination.

skillTree.name: Silk Conquest
skillTree.description: Honeyed words may not be the fastest way to take over a country compared to strength of arms, but this one's silver tongue can accomplish seemingly anything.

skillTree.name: Elven Scholar
skillTree.description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.

skillTree.name: Despoiler
skillTree.description: Few excel at ravaging the lands of their foes as much as this one. Leaving a bloody trail in their wake, they turn the lands and peoples of their foes into fuel for their war.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

skillTree.name: Thunderbolt
skillTree.description: Striking like the storm, this general has drilled their army to deploy far faster than most. Able to force the foe into disadvantageous fights before marshalling their own forces, this army is rarely engaged on even terms.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Ravager
skillTree.description: If they cannot control these realms, this lord will burn it down around them.

skillTree.name: Destroyer
skillTree.description: The only true form of control over a thing is the power to destroy it.

effects.description:
Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +20%
	(Lord's army)

Income from all forms of post-battle loot: +30%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lurker
skillTree.description: Few have a talent for catching enemy armies off-guard like this one, always striking when the foe is marching or recuperating.

skillTree.name: Legend
skillTree.description: This one is wreathed in a sense of gravitas that draws the best and brightest to them like moths to the flame, eager to learn - or perhaps take it for themselves.

skillTree.name: Great Generals
skillTree.description: Leading entire armies of men, daemons, or monsters is not a task for the average warrior. Understanding the strategies needed to get the a concentration of force to the appropriate location, and the tactics needed to make use of it against another force, requires a mixture of practice and experience.

skillTree.name: Accomplished Aides
skillTree.description: Heroes are future lords and legends - valiant fighters or potent sorcerers, each well worth the investment for the future.

skillTree.name: Ascended Retinues
skillTree.description: Generals require excellent lieutenants to command their forces effectively - a concept this lord has taken to heart, taking great pain to cultivate the best and brightest amongst their entourages to ever greater heights.

skillTree.name: Auxilia
skillTree.description: No army can master every aspect of combat without compromising in some aspects. Making use of auxilaries from allied forces allows for a more versatile approach to combat, especially if the disparate units train together.

backgroundSkills.name: Disorganised
backgroundSkills.description: If you want something done, shoot this one first - it'll make your life a lot easier.

effects.description:
Upkeep: +10% for Archers, Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Organised
backgroundSkills.description: "You need a plan. Never let anyone tell you otherwise. Devise a plan, then execute it - and preferably the enemy - haha!"

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Archers, Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Efficient
backgroundSkills.description: Form, fire, charge, flank, repeat. This one shows that it really can be that simple.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Archers, Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Wasteful
backgroundSkills.description: "Yes, we will hit our own troops, but we'll hit theirs as well. We have reserves. Attack!"

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: -30%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Unsentimental
backgroundSkills.description: Sentiments - and indeed feelings of any kind - are not for public display, in their estimation.

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Avaricious
backgroundSkills.description: Their love of shiny things is so great this one could be an honorary Greenskin!

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +50%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Bird-Brained
backgroundSkills.description: How thisâ€¦ absolute, card-carrying moron has survived this far is anyone's guess, and a mystery to all!

backgroundSkills.name: Observant
backgroundSkills.description: If you wish to live, it's best to keep your eyes open and your head down.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Adept
backgroundSkills.description: More than skilled, this one shows great proficiency in matters of war.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +250
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Pale & Wan
backgroundSkills.description: It's as much effort as this one can make to lift a blade, let alone swing it at an opponent with force.

backgroundSkills.name: Trained
backgroundSkills.description: Every action is executed seemingly without effort.

backgroundSkills.name: Dangerous
backgroundSkills.description: You really don't want to be on the receiving end of an attack made by this one. You really donâ€™t.

backgroundSkills.name: Squishy
backgroundSkills.description: Some warriors are like rocks - hard and immovable. This one is like jellyâ€¦

backgroundSkills.name: Elusive
backgroundSkills.description: This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.

backgroundSkills.name: Resilient
backgroundSkills.description: Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.

backgroundSkills.name: Pigeon-Chested
backgroundSkills.description: Bones are not supposed to be on the outside.

backgroundSkills.name: Hale & Hearty
backgroundSkills.description: The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.

backgroundSkills.name: Vigorous
backgroundSkills.description: This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.

backgroundSkills.name: Scornful
backgroundSkills.description: "Strategy? Tactics? Piffle, more like. Charrrrgggge!!!"

effects.description:
Leadership: -10 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Respectful
backgroundSkills.description: "Our forefathers followed the way and overcame great adversity. We should not ignore their lessons."

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Doctrinal
backgroundSkills.description: "Right, are you listening? Good. There's only one way to do things and that's by the book."

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Fay
backgroundSkills.description: There's something of the other world about this one; this cruel plane has failed to engage them.

backgroundSkills.name: Strong-Willed
backgroundSkills.description: Some minds are more susceptible to magical influence than others, but this one is strong indeed.

backgroundSkills.name: Dragon-Willed
backgroundSkills.description: Immovable and resolute in their will, this one is as determined as the World Dragon himself!

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Dragon units (minimum 1)
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.name: Ill-Prepared
backgroundSkills.description: This one would forget their head if it wasn't, er, attached.

backgroundSkills.name: Competent
backgroundSkills.description: This one understands tactics, and how to vary them, well enough to generally defeat the foe.

backgroundSkills.name: Resistant
backgroundSkills.description: Action, inaction, change - you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Elven Discipline
backgroundSkills.description: High Elven discipline is renowned across the world, known to any who have fought the Asur. Few other militaries even approach it; none surpass.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Purity of Form
backgroundSkills.description: This prince of the Asur is said to carry the blood of the dragons, so large his form and fierce his power. No less skilled than his counterparts, he brings incredible power to bear on the battlefield.

backgroundSkills.name: Asur Foresight
backgroundSkills.description: Human strategists are forced to make do with mere decades of experience, but to one who has led armies for centuries or even millennia, the realm of true strategy is but an old friend. What is an army, but a manifestation of political will? What is war, but a game played by old men with the lives of the young?

backgroundSkills.name: Eataine's Finest
backgroundSkills.description: Eataine outfits its infantry with some of the best armor available to any Asur kingdom, granting extraordinary durability to any frontline.

backgroundSkills.name: Martial Excellence
backgroundSkills.description: One of the oldest and now most powerful kingdoms on Ulthuan, Eataine's discipline and martial prowess has become legendary. This Prince has been on so many expeditions, fought so many wars, that his army is stellar even by those vaunted standards.

backgroundSkills.name: Lord of the Dragonflight
backgroundSkills.description: Caledor is home to the dragons, and few other than the oldest and strongest of Caledor can yet rouse them. Those who can wield the power of millennia, delivered dispassionately by some of the mighiest monsters in all the world.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Caledorian Steel
backgroundSkills.description: Ithilmar armor barely contains the pride of Caledor, yet these noble knights ride to battle impregnable within a shield of their own confidence. Not merely in gear, but by their own skill at arms, the mobility to avoid harm yet the durability to take the greatest blows and shrug them off.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +20% for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Caledorian Vigor
backgroundSkills.description: Thundering hooves ring, heralding the charge of Caledor's finest. So long as their spirits burn bright, so long as their discip;ine holds, they are unstoppable.

effects.description:
Attribute: Perfect Vigor for cavalry
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +20% for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Eternal Flame
backgroundSkills.description: The fires of Vaul's Anvil burn forever within the hearts and souls of every son of Caledor. Those who have seen the flame at the heat of the world fear no other, and strike with the force of a world-forging hammer.

effects.description:
Fire resistance: +30% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Reaver Elite
backgroundSkills.description: The kingdom of Ellyrion is known for the best horses in all Ulthuan - perhaps the world. This prince calls it home, and brings some of the finest cavalry in all Ulthuan to bear on his foes.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +25% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +25% for all cavalry, hounds and warmachines
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Plains of Ellyrion
backgroundSkills.description: Ellyrian horses are unnaturally fast, used to navigating the strange spacial anomalies of Ellyrion itself. Brought to bear on the battlefield, clad in light Ithilmar armor, this prince can bring his force to bear from unexpected angles across vast distances, no matter how safe a foe may think himself.

backgroundSkills.name: Forest's Empathy
backgroundSkills.description: The forest spirits inhabiting his home are what this Prince of Avelorn is most familiar with, but a lifetime among nature has gifted him remarkable talent with all manner of monsters, an intuitive ability to understand and direct them that few could hope to match.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for enemy monstrous units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for monsters and monstrous infantry
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Monster units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: High Mage-Prince
backgroundSkills.description: Few princes of Saphery are unfamiliar with magic, but fewer still can balance physical perfection with mystical mastery as this one has. The Winds wrap around him, forever ready to enforce his will.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for all spells

backgroundSkills.name: Blademaster
backgroundSkills.description: This lord of Saphery has trained with blades for centuries beyond memory, spending long years among swordmasters and defeating most of them. His martial skill and intuitive understanding of aggressive melee tactics make him a terrifying force at the head of many of the finest swordsmen Ulthuan has ever seen.

effects.description:
Armor-piercing damage: +20% for Swordmasters of Hoeth and Loremasters of Hoeth
	(Lord's army)

Melee defense: +6 for Swordmasters of Hoeth and Loremasters of Hoeth
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +20% for Swordmasters of Hoeth and Loremasters of Hoeth
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Relentless Discipline
backgroundSkills.description: Battered and desolated, but unbroken. Yvresse breeds some of the sternest men and women in all Ulthuan, a ruthless environment this proud prince both survived and excelled within. Overcoming the foe is a simple question of resolve; those who cannot survive will die.

effects.description:
Ward save: +10% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Men of the Forest
backgroundSkills.description: Chrace is a savage place, covered with forest and befouled by Druchii dark magics. Only a man born and raised amidst the trees could direct armies through it with such casual ease, turning impassible terrain into armor for his forces.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Lion's Pride
backgroundSkills.description: Chrace is well known for its lions - both the brave woodsmen who hunt the terrifying beasts of the corrupted forests, and the proud war lions who call it home. While oft at odds, a true prince of Chrace can bring out the strength of both in combined-arms tactics that see the fury of the untamed wilderness brought to bear against their shared foes.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +8 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +8 for War Lions and Lion Chariots units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Ruthless Hunters
backgroundSkills.description: The ruthless predators of his homeland can be used as a tool by a Chracian prince brave enough to accept the risks. The last thing his foes will ever hear is the keening cry of mighty eagles, the feroucious roar of white lions, before they are ripped asunder.

effects.description:
Armor-piercing weapon damage: +75 for Giant Eagles
	(Lord's army)

Bonus versus Large: +15 for War Lions of Chrace
	(Lord's army)

Movement speed: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Predator and Prey
backgroundSkills.description: The woodsmen of Chrace are used to navigating harsh, wild environments, filled with predators who would see them dead. Using some of the same tactics against foes, bringing all their skill and experience againstarmies all too similar to the Druchii scum profaning their forests, makes a Chracian ambush deadly indeed.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.name: Charioteer of Tiranoc
backgroundSkills.description: Charioteers of Tiranoc are the finest in all Ulthuan, bringing their terrifying engines of war to bear against any foe who would stand against the Asur. Any who fight from similar mounts can be used to similar effect, crushing foes beneath the five-spoked wheel of fate.

effects.description:
Movement speed: +15% for non-character units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +12 for Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +50% for chariot units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Avengers
backgroundSkills.description: The horrific fate of Nagarythe - the cruel treachery of kin and against kin - can never be forgotten. Born amidst the ruins and forever imprinted upon them, no amount of suspicion from his own brethren will sway this dour prince from revenge on the monster who sundered the Asur.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
